Tourism Theories & Perspectives

The purpose of the module is to explore and appreciate the contribution of the social sciences to comprehending current global tourism movements. Adopting a multidisciplinary approach the module will require you to examine the relationship between the 'business' and 'non-business' role of tourism in society. You will gain a comprehensive understanding of tourism theories and perspectives and given the opportunity to acquire and develop a range of analytical techniques.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Demonstrate an ability to apply and analyze specific theoretical and conceptual frameworks relevant to understanding global tourism movements.

+  Consider how social science theories and concepts inform approaches to solving tourism problems, proposing solutions where applicable.

+  Demonstrate knowledge and critical understanding of current social science thinking and scholarship to understanding and analyzing the role of tourism in contemporary society.

+  Participate in a discussion forum that effectively considers the application of key social science theories and perspectives to contemporary tourism issues.
